title: How to Be a Zombie Actor in Zombie Paintball

steps.headline: Start off learning your way in orientation.
steps.description: You should learn the ins and outs of your zombie paintball course. Make sure you learn exactly where to clock in, where belongings are to be stored, where armor is located, and where the zombies are to be positioned once zombie paintball begins.

steps.headline: Armor up.
steps.description: Armor should be provided, including a helmet and chest/rib protection.

steps.headline: Go to your assigned station quickly and quietly.
steps.description: You need to make sure you aren't seen by the "humans", so be discreet. Zombies may have a specific back-way to enter to avoid being seen, so make sure that that is covered in orientation.

steps.headline: Await the arrival of the humans.
steps.description: This will probably involve a lot of standing around, so just have patience.

steps.headline: Move out from your hiding space once the humans arrive.
steps.description: Act like a zombie as you shuffle towards them.

steps.headline: Go down with headshots.
steps.description: You want the humans to feel the satisfaction of shooting and killing a zombie, so crumple to the ground once they get a headshot in. With larger batches of humans, you are more likely to be shot in the head faster. You don't want the humans to be shooting into a field of (re)killed zombies, so wait a bit longer before you "die". You may have to receive a few headshots. Because some people are just like that, you may sometimes experience a round in which one or multiple people continue to "double-tap" you after you have fallen. When that happens, quickly stand back up and resume your shambling. Continuing to play dead when you are being shot is not fun for the audience, and probably won't feel much better for you.

steps.headline: Wait for the humans to leave, and retreat to your post.
Repeat this process until zombie paintball is over.
steps.description: The course may last longer than the official time slate, depending on how fast the humans clear it, but there will be a signal at the end for you to pack up and go home.

steps.headline: Clean and turn in your armor before you clock out.
steps.description: Follow this routine until the Halloween season is over.

text: Start off learning your way in orientation. You should learn the ins and outs of your zombie paintball course. Make sure you learn exactly where to clock in, where belongings are to be stored, where armor is located, and where the zombies are to be positioned once zombie paintball begins. Armor up. Armor should be provided, including a helmet and chest/rib protection. Go to your assigned station quickly and quietly. You need to make sure you aren't seen by the "humans", so be discreet. Zombies may have a specific back-way to enter to avoid being seen, so make sure that that is covered in orientation. Await the arrival of the humans. This will probably involve a lot of standing around, so just have patience. Move out from your hiding space once the humans arrive. Act like a zombie as you shuffle towards them. Go down with headshots. You want the humans to feel the satisfaction of shooting and killing a zombie, so crumple to the ground once they get a headshot in. With larger batches of humans, you are more likely to be shot in the head faster. You don't want the humans to be shooting into a field of (re)killed zombies, so wait a bit longer before you "die". You may have to receive a few headshots. Because some people are just like that, you may sometimes experience a round in which one or multiple people continue to "double-tap" you after you have fallen. When that happens, quickly stand back up and resume your shambling. Continuing to play dead when you are being shot is not fun for the audience, and probably won't feel much better for you. Wait for the humans to leave, and retreat to your post.  Repeat this process until zombie paintball is over. The course may last longer than the official time slate, depending on how fast the humans clear it, but there will be a signal at the end for you to pack up and go home. Clean and turn in your armor before you clock out. Follow this routine until the Halloween season is over.
